designations.source: A Review of the scarce and threatened spiders (Araneae) of Great Britain: Species Status No. 22 (Sep 2017)
designations.source_description: This review assesses the threat of extinction, based on IUCN Red List categories, for the species recorded in Britain and considered eligible for consideration under those IUCN criteria. This report was commissioned to update the national threat status of Araneae using IUCN methodology for assessing threat. It covers all species of Arachnids in Great Britain, identifying those that are rare and/or under threat as well as non-threatened and non-native species.
designations.reporting_category: Nationally Scarce, Nationally Rare and Other Species
designations.designation: Nationally Rare. Includes Red Listed taxa
designations.designation_description: Nationally Rare - Occurring in 15 or fewer hectads in Great Britain. Includes rare species qualifying under the main IUCN criteria.

designations.designation_description: A taxon is Critically Endangered when the best available evidence indicates that it meets any of the criteria A to E for Critically Endangered (see Section V), and it is therefore considered to be facing an extremely high risk of extinction in the wild.  Possibly extinct indicates that there is a small chance that the taxon may still be extant, and hence  should not be listed as Extinct until local or unconfirmed reports have been discounted, and adequate surveys have failed to find any individuals.
designations.comments: Formerly recorded from ancient beech woods at three locations in Surrey and Hampshire, but has not been found at any of these since 1969. Threats: The loss of established beech woods. In past years, foresters have clear-felled ancient beech woods on the North Downs and used a nurse crop of conifers in the replanting, a practice which could be detrimental to the ancient woodland fauna and flora, including this spider.
